page.title: 03WELSHPOOL-A TOURIST CENTRE
page.content: The most impressive tourist attraction is{Powys Castle.} Built in the 13th and 14th Centuries, it stands on a rocky outcrop about \ mile outside Welshpool. It is presently occupied by the sixth Earl of Powys but was donated to the National Trust in 1952. It now receives 70,000 visitors a year. { The Welshpool and Llanfair Light {Railway,}one of the "Great Little Trains of Wales", was constructed in 1903 to a gauge of 2'6". It was closed in 1956 but rescued by a Preservation Society which has cleared the line and built a terminus at Raven Square Welshpool. The railway links Welshpool with the small town of Llanfair Caereinion, a distance of about 8 miles.
